variable.name: isp-hlq
variable.label: ISPF(ISP) HLQ
variable.abstract: HLQ for the ISPF target datasets
variable.description:
Please verify with your z/OS support person what
the HLQ is. You could also look at your ISPPROF
concatenation to have a clue of what the values
are . Usually it is ISP or SYS1.

variable.name: isf-hlq
variable.label: SDSF(ISF) HLQ
variable.abstract: HLQ for the SDSF Target Libraries (usually SYS1 or ISF)
variable.description:
Please verify with your z/OS support person what
the HLQ is. You could also look at your ISPPROF
concatenation to have a clue of what the values
are . Usually it is ISF or SYS1.

variable.name: hfs-dsn
variable.label: HFS Dataset Name(s)
variable.abstract: Please enter the dataset name that will be converted to ZFS :
variable.description:
The conversion will result in a new ZFS file
defined with the same size of the orifinal
HFS file. If you want a ZFS file that is
bigger than the original, please pre-allocate
the ZFS. You can use the IBM-MF-AUTO-ZFS-DEFINE
workflow to pre-allocate it.

variable.name: zos-hlq
variable.label: ZOS HLQ
variable.description:
Please verify with your z/OS support person what
the HLQ is. Usually it is SYS1.

variable.name: zfs-string
variable.label: String to replaced the string indicated in the HFS String Field
variable.abstract: This string will replace the string indicated in hte hfs-string
variable.description: where "from" is a string which if found in the file system name will be changed to "to" for example, /hfs/zfs/ will change all HFS to ZFS

variable.name: hfs-string
variable.label: HFS String
variable.abstract: This string will be replaced to generate the ZFS file
variable.description: where "from" is a string which if found in the file system name will be changed to "to" for example, /hfs/zfs/ will change all HFS to ZFS

variable.name: zfs-replace
variable.label: Use Replace
variable.abstract: Select "Yes" if you want to use string replacing to generate the new ZFS
variable.description:
Select Yes if you want to use string replacing for the
new generated ZFS
